author: Taylor Brokesh
title: VA Showcase to be held at Virginia Beach Sports Center this weekend | 13newsnow.com
text: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va. — This weekend, the largest indoor track meet in the country arrives to Virginia Beach. The VA Showcase is widely acclaimed as the best invitational in the country and will give approximately 6,000 athletes from 25 states and two countries the chance to compete on what the city called "one of the highest-profile tracks in the world." Athletes will include Olympic gold medalists, including Chesapeake native 17-year-old Quincy Wilson , national record holders, and U20 world record holders. Tickets are $15 per day or $25 for a full weekend pass. You can can find more information about the meet here.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 创业板ETF天弘（159977）跌0.99%，半日成交额1837.54万元|创业板_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，创业板ETF天弘（159977）跌0.99%，报2.109元，成交额1837.54万元。创业板ETF天弘（159977）重仓股方面， 宁德时代 截止午盘跌1.13%， 东方财富 跌2.19%， 汇川技术 跌0.05%， 迈瑞医疗 跌1.30%， 阳光电源 跌2.96%， 温氏股份 跌0.58%， 中际旭创 涨3.03%， 新易盛 涨0.13%， 亿纬锂能 涨0.35%， 爱尔眼科 跌1.16%。
创业板ETF天弘（159977）业绩比较基准为 创业板指数 收益率，管理人为天弘基金管理有限公司，基金经理为林心龙，成立（2019-09-12）以来回报为25.39%，近一个月回报为1.17%。

author: Agencia EFE
title: Bangladesh Students Clash with Awami League Supporters
text: Dhaka, Aug 15 (EFE).- Groups of students wielding sticks attacked supporters of the Awami League, the party of disgraced ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina on Thursday in Dhaka. The Awami League supporters had gathered to commemorate the assassination of Bangladesh's independence hero, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, also Hasina's father. According to Bangladeshi media, the clashes occurred outside Rahman's former residence in Dhaka, where hundreds of students attacked several Awami League members. “We have been here since morning so that no one can create any violence,” said Saidul Islam Saad. The student of Sir Salimullah Medical College donned the national flag as a headband and carried a stick covered in green near Mujib Museum in Dhanmondi-32, which was burned into ashes after the fall of Hasina. Bangladesh people protest to demand justice outside of the court where Bangladeshi former law minister Anisul Huq and former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's adviser Salman F Rahman are standing on trial at the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate (CMM) Court in Dhaka, Bangladesh, 14 August 2024. EFE-EPA\/MONIRUL ALAM “We have seen that there are attempts to foil our revolution, like our judges tried to do a few days ago. We will not allow anyone to do this,” he told EFE. He patrolled an area of Dhaka where Awami League demonstrations were expected Until this year, August 15 was observed as the National Day of Mourning, commemorating Rahman's assassination, along with most of his family members, at his official residence in 1975. Hasina was not in Bangladesh at the time. Mass events and demonstrations were typically held to mark the day. However, after she was ousted unceremoniously on August 5, under pressure from student protests, the new interim government designated August 15 as a regular calendar day without explanation. Bangladeshi former law minister Anisul Huq and former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's adviser Salman F Rahman (C, wearing police helmets and vests) are escorted to the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate (CMM) Court in Dhaka, Bangladesh, 14 August 2024. EFE-EPA\/FILE\/MONIRUL ALAM The protests, which began peacefully on July 1, were led by university students opposed to a controversial job quota system for public employment that favored descendants of the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War fighters. The demonstrations rapidly escalated and were met with severe repression by the authorities. By August 5, the situation had become untenable for Hasina, the leader of the Awami League, who had ruled uninterruptedly since 2009. According to the EFE tally, more than 400 people have died in Bangladesh since student protests against Hasina’s government began on July 1. The daughter of Bangladesh’s founder was disgraced and forced to resign and flee Dhaka on an air force plane that landed in India. EFE am-hbc-ssk

author: Jessie Molloy
title: State police warns residents of scam callers impersonating officers
text: Will County — The Illinois State Police issued a warning to Illinois residents on Thursday to be wary of phone scammers impersonating ISP officers. According to the news release, several reports have been made in the past week from individuals who received phone calls from a person claiming to be an ISP investigator and telling the residents that their identity has been stolen. These calls are fraudulent. Illinois State Police agents do not make cold calls and will never request personal or financial information over the phone, according to the release. The state police also will not ask you to verify information in this way, according to the release. The ISP advises anyone who receives a call like this to ask for the caller’s name, badge number, and phone number then hang up. Do not provide any personal information to the caller, according to the release. You should then call your region’s investigative office, which can be found on the [ISP website](https://isp.illinois.gov/CriminalInvestigations/Zones) to verify the scam, according to the release. Anyone who has provided information to a scammer in this manner or thinks their identity may have been stolen, police recommend contacting each of the three credit bureaus — [Equifax](https://www.equifax.com/personal/credit-report-services/credit-freeze/), [Experian](https://www.experian.com/freeze/center.html), and [Transunion](https://www.transunion.com/credit-freeze) — to put a security freeze on your credit and prevent anyone from opening credit cards in your name, according to the release. You can also call the Illinois Attorney General’s Identity Theft Hotline at 1-866-999-5630, where a Consumer Advocate will help guide you through the recovery process.

author: Manuel Galeazzi
title: Educar+e; un programa de Grupo Omnilife-Chivas
text: Durante 2023 Grupo Omnilife-Chivas, que lidera Amaury Vergara, generó una serie de acciones humanitarias; como lo fueron actividades de voluntariado con el staff de Grupo Omnilife-Chivas y alumnos de Educar+e, para juntos colaborar en pro de las comunidades y las organizaciones civiles con las que Fundación Jorge Vergara trabaja, obteniendo los siguientes resultados: a. Se beneficiaron a 12 mil 879 personas a través de donaciones en especie; b. Labor social con [Chivas](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/deportes/la-drastica-decision-que-acaba-de-tomar-club-chivas-y-que-podria-retirar-a-alexis-vega/): jugadoras y jugadores de diferentes categorías de Chivas participan en acciones de convivencia con comunidades., se beneficiaron a 665 participantes; c. Educar+e: participaron 60 alumnos de bachillerato en dos casas hogar con 60 beneficiarios; d. Celebración Día del Niño: fueron beneficiarios 110 menores, donde participaron 12 personas en el staff. A través de este programa también se desarrollaron: e. Imparables: Empresarias SEYTÚ Colombia, donde los colaboradores del staff beneficiaron a 45 personas; f. Santa por un día (el staff brindó uno o varios regalos a niñas, niños y adultos mayores en situación de vulnerabilidad social): 300 personas del staff se transformaron en Santa Claus y 25 colaboradores del staff participaron en una posada, beneficiado a 300 personas; y g. Rehabilitación de cancha del hogar cabañas por parte del personal de operaciones y mantenimiento del Estadio Akron. Recordemos que [Amaury Vergara](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/deportes/amaury-vergara-ignora-a-fernando-hierro-en-contratacion-de-chicharito-hernandez/), presidente y director general de Omnilife, ha afirmado que: “Uno de nuestros objetivos, es que el Estadio Akron continúe consolidándose como el estadio de futbol más sustentable de Latinoamérica, de cara a la Copa Mundial de la FIFA 2026. La visión original de mi padre Jorge Vergara, fue desde los inicios crear un estadio sustentable, ya que esta es la razón por la cual tenemos la captación de agua pluvial y la planta de tratamiento de agua, entre otras cosas”. Grupo Omnilife-Chivas, está adherido al Pacto Mundial de las Naciones Unidas; que es la mayor iniciativa mundial de sustentabilidad, desde el 2021, y trabajan bajo sus 10 principios. Este año continuarán la ruta verde con el equipo de futbol más popular de México y Estados Unidos.

author: Alexander Olumese, PharmD
title: Pharmacist explains why following prescription drug instructions can be so difficult
text:
Prescription drugs can save a person’s life, but not following the instructions for their usage can be a recipe for disaster. Nonadherence to medication regimens is alarmingly common and can have dire consequences. Not taking medications as prescribed can lead to an illness actually getting worse, increased healthcare costs, and even avoidable hospitalizations and death. For chronic conditions like hypertension or diabetes, where symptoms might not be immediately visible, the temptation to skip doses can be high, but the long-term effects can be devastating.
Following medication schedules and instructions for their use ensures the effectiveness of the treatment. It allows the medicine to work as intended, controlling symptoms and slowing disease progression. In cases where patients need to take antibiotics or antivirals, proper adherence is crucial to completely eradicate an infection and prevent
antibiotic resistance.
Why do people misuse medications?
One major hurdle that keeps people from adhering to these directions is the cost of medication.
High prices can discourage patients from filling their prescriptions or lead them to ration their medications. The best ways to overcome this common obstacle include:
- Using
generic medications
- Patient assistance programs
Co-pay cards
Your pharmacist can be a valuable resource in finding cost-effective alternatives.
Psychological factors, such as
fear of side-effects or skepticism about the necessity of medication, often hinder adherence as well. Open communication with healthcare providers can demystify these concerns. Understanding the purpose and benefits of your prescription and its potential side-effects can make a significant difference.
There are also physical barriers, like difficulty swallowing pills or
traveling to the pharmacy, can impede adherence. Pharmacists can offer solutions like medication delivery services, alternative formulations, or easy-to-use packaging. Don’t hesitate to discuss these challenges with your healthcare provider.
How can you simplify your medication usage?
Complicated medication regimens can be overwhelming. Using pill organizers,
setting alarms, or coordinating with your pharmacist for medication synchronization can help — this means trying to sync up a person’s prescriptions so they can pick up all their pills at one time.
Pharmacists can also review your medications to streamline the regimen, potentially
reducing the number of pills you need.
Educating yourself about your medications is empowering. Understanding what each medication does, how it helps your condition, and the consequences of nonadherence can motivate you to stick to your regimen. Ask your healthcare provider questions and make use of
reputable online resources for additional information.
Technology can be a great ally in improving adherence. There are numerous apps designed to remind you to take your medication, track your doses, and even provide information about your drugs. Leveraging these tools can make managing your medication regimen less daunting.
You might also be interested in:
5 Concerning Food-Drug Interactions: Pharmacist Warns Not To Mix These With Your Medications Bad medical news makes patients more likely to choose pricey drugs over generics Traveling With Prescription Drugs: 5 Essential Tips From A Pharmacist

author: malvern-online.com
title: XMAR Launches Pilot Phase of its Online Bunker Trading Platform | User | malvern-online.com
text:
XMAR announces the launch of its online bunker trading platform, transforming fuel purchasing by connecting users with 1,500 suppliers across 500 global ports.
LIMASSOL, CYPRUS / ACCESSWIRE / October 17, 2024 / XMAR is pleased to announce the launch of the shipping industry's first comprehensive digital bunker trading platform, now in a closed pilot phase. XMAR's AI-powered platform connects users with a network of over 1,500 verified suppliers across 500 global ports , offering a more streamlined experience for bunker fuel procurement. These figures have been sourced and verified through internal data, ensuring reliability and accuracy. With a single enquiry, users receive multiple competitive offers and gain transparency throughout the purchasing process.
Companies can now join the waitlist on xmar.com to experience the platform during the pilot phase. Early participants will have the chance to help fine-tune the platform while benefiting from features such as 30-day financing and simplified order management.
Simplified and Transparent Bunker Procurement
Unlike conventional bunker procurement platforms, XMAR is designed to offer more than just data. The platform enables users to submit one enquiry and receive multiple competitive offers, significantly reducing the effort involved in coordinating with multiple suppliers. A live chat feature is available for each order, allowing users to receive prompt responses and real-time support.
"XMAR provides full transparency and control over the bunker purchasing process," explains Christoph Stork, CEO of XMAR. "Users can manage their orders, documents, and payment deadlines with ease while having access to 1,500 suppliers across 500 ports worldwide . This ensures that users find the best deal and have visibility throughout their order's lifecycle."
XMAR uses advanced AI tools to enhance accuracy in the trading process, providing users with predictive data and performing checks to ensure reliable transactions. "Our AI-driven tools help users make well-informed decisions and enhance the efficiency of their trades," adds Stork. "We are continuously refining these capabilities to offer even more advanced features in the future."
Supporting SMEs with Competitive Solutions
XMAR's platform is designed with small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in mind, offering competitive bunker prices and finance options on every order. SMEs, who have often been underserved in a market dominated by larger corporations, can now access the same benefits of efficiency and cost savings through XMAR.
"Our goal is to level the playing field for SMEs," says Stork. "With XMAR, companies can source bunker fuel more efficiently while benefiting from fewer points of contact and a streamlined process where all steps-from offer to payment-are managed in one place."
Flexible Finance and Comprehensive Order Management
In addition to simplifying bunker fuel sourcing, XMAR also offers financial support to SMEs through flexible credit terms. This allows companies to manage cash flow more effectively while securing the best possible fuel deals. Users also benefit from having a complete record of all their orders, documents, and payment deadlines consolidated in one place, making it easier to manage their fuel sourcing operations.
Join the Waitlist Today
While the platform is in its pilot phase, XMAR is inviting companies to join the waitlist at xmar.com and participate in shaping the future of digital bunker trading. Early adopters will gain exclusive access to the platform's features during the pilot phase and help contribute to its continuous improvement.
For more information and to join the waitlist, visit www.xmar.com .
About XMAR
XMAR is an online bunker trading platform designed to simplify the bunker fuel purchasing process. With access to 1,500 suppliers across 500 global ports , XMAR enables users to receive multiple offers with every enquiry and provides live chat for each order to ensure timely communication. The platform also offers flexible financing options and comprehensive order management tools, giving SMEs the transparency and support they need to compete effectively in the bunker trading market.
Media Contact: Arturs Mamedovs
Project Manager
mamedovsarturs (at) xmar (dot) com
+357 99879627
www.xmar.com

author: Nicola Avolio
title: Campania ancora nella morsa di pioggia e gelo, prorogata l’allerta meteo
text:
La Protezione Civile della Regione Campania, a seguito delle valutazioni del Centro Funzionale, ha emanato una allerta meteo per temporali di livello Giallo.
Dalle 9 di domani, sabato 14 dicembre, alle 9 di dopodomani, domenica 15 dicembre, è previsto l’arrivo di una nuova perturbazione con precipitazioni intense sulla gran parte del territorio e un rischio idrogeologico localizzato.
Queste le zone interessate: 1 (Piana Campana, Napoli, Isole, Area Vesuviana); 2 (Alto Volturno e Matese), 3 (Penisola Sorrentino-Amalfitana, Monti di Sarno e Monti Picentini); 5 (Tusciano e Alto Sele); 6 (Piana Sele e Alto Cilento); 8 (Basso Cilento).
Saranno possibili allagamenti, esondazioni, ruscellamenti, innalzamento dei livelli idrometrici dei corsi d’acqua, caduta massi e frane in considerazione della fragilità dei territori. A causa della saturazione dei suoli saranno possibili frane e caduta massi anche in assenza di nuove precipitazioni.
Si ricorda ai Sindaci di tutta la Campania di attivare i Centri Operativi Comunali (COC), di attuare tutte le misure previste dai rispettivi piani di protezione civile.

author: Laila Afifa
title: Israel Pounds Central Gaza, Tousands of Palestinians Try to Escape - ASEAN En.tempo.co
text: Israel Pounds Central Gaza, Tousands of Palestinians Try to Escape 28 December 2023 06:40 WIB TEMPO.CO, Gaza - Israeli forces pounded central [Gaza](https://www.tempo.co/search?waktu=&kanal=&subkanal=&domain=2&q=gaza) by land, sea, and air on Wednesday, Dec. 27, and Palestinian authorities reported dozens more deaths, with the U.N. health agency saying thousands of people were trying to flee the fighting. Reflecting Israeli resolve to wipe out Hamas despite international calls for a ceasefire amid a humanitarian crisis, Israel's military chief Herzi Halevi said on Tuesday the war would last many months. There were "no shortcuts in dismantling a terrorist organization", he said. Israel also signaled it could step up its response to cross-border attacks from northern neighbor Lebanon, where Hamas ally Hezbollah is based. A Gaza health ministry statement said an Israeli air strike killed 20 Palestinians on Wednesday near the Al-Amal Hospital in Khan Younis, in the southern Gaza Strip. There was no immediate comment from the Israeli military. In central Gaza's Al-Maghazi district, five Palestinians were killed in one air strike, medics said, while to the north in Gaza City health officials said the bodies of seven Palestinians killed overnight arrived at Al Shifa Hospital. Residents in the central Gaza Strip said with nightfall, Israeli tank shelling intensified east of Al-Bureij and Al-Maghazi refugee camps where tanks have been trying to force their way through. Israel's military on Wednesday reported three more soldiers killed in action in Gaza, bringing total military losses in the enclave since ground operations began on Oct. 20 to 166. The war erupted after Hamas killed 1,200 people and captured 240 hostages in a cross-border rampage on Oct. 7, the deadliest day in Israel's history. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has responded with an assault that has laid much of Hamas-ruled Gaza to waste. The Gaza health ministry said Israeli forces had killed 195 Palestinians and wounded 325 in the past 24 hours, bringing the recorded toll to 21,110 killed and 55,243 wounded in Israeli attacks in the coastal Palestinian territory since Oct. 7. Nearly all the enclave's 2.3 million people have been driven from their homes, many several times.
